sub_topic: Using the power rule to differentiate functions
message_1: Find the derivative of the function f(x) = 3x^7 using the power rule.
message_2:
To find the derivative of the function f(x) = 3x^7 using the power rule, we apply the rule which states that if f(x) = ax^n, then f'(x) = n*ax^(n-1).

In this case, a = 3 and n = 7. So, we have:

f'(x) = 7 * 3x^(7-1)
f'(x) = 21x^6
